title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:00 <happyfeet11> sorry i'm having a network problem here  
00:00 <happyfeet11> on the site is written , it would be nice HQL or SQL  
00:01 <happyfeet11> what connection does it have with the application in this case since the event objects are stored in documents  
00:03 <happyfeet11> i'm just wondering?  
00:03 <happyfeet11> please help me  
00:05 <happyfeet11> hi sdumitriu  
00:06 <@sdumitriu> HQL is how you currently query the data  
00:07 <@sdumitriu> You don't query the relational database using SQL, you query an abstract data model using a data-oriented query language  
00:07 <@sdumitriu> HQL or XWQL  
00:07 <happyfeet11> very good to know  
00:07 <@sdumitriu> And maybe JPQL if cjdelisle pushes for it  
00:08 <happyfeet11> i'll install the XAR file again, and work on the calendar  
00:09 <happyfeet11> Just to let know, I can do the Mobile skin for the team as well if need be  
00:10 <happyfeet11> where is the log for this chat?  
00:11 <@sdumitriu> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/  
00:12 <happyfeet11> thanks and talk later  
00:12 <happyfeet11> i've to go now  
00:12 <happyfeet11> has quit  
00:26 <mflorea> has quit

07:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:11 <Hyper-Core> has joined #xwiki

08:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <bblfish> has quit  
08:41 <vmassol> mflorea: hi. The history on xwiki-platform looks really werid… origin/master is way down after origin/xwiki-3.0 whereas it should be the opposite IMO. If you have gitx just run it on  xwiki-platform clone  
08:41 <vmassol> we need to tell sergiu when he's online  
08:41 <vmassol> it doesn't look right to me  
08:42 <+mflorea> vmassol: I did a lot of merges on 3.0, I don't think there is any problem  
08:42 <vmassol> have a look  
08:42 <vmassol> did you check?  
08:43 <+mflorea> what should I check?  
08:43 <vmassol> see my message  
08:43 <vmassol> run gitx  
08:43 <vmassol> it's all inverted  
08:44 <+mflorea> I don't have gitx  
08:44 <vmassol> or gitk  
08:44 <vmassol> but you should have gitx it helps a lot  
08:44 <vmassol> it's really nice  
08:44 <+mflorea> on google I see gitx is for macos :)  
08:44 <vmassol> this one: http://brotherbard.com/blog/2010/03/experimental-gitx-fork/  
08:44 <vmassol> ah right  
08:45 <vmassol> so gitk for you I guess  
08:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <+mflorea> vmassol: I installed gitk but it displays only the current branch. I don't see anything wrong on master.  
09:01 <vmassol> you should see all labels  
09:01 <vmassol> (I see labels displayed on http://www.google.fr/search?q=gitk&hl=en&prmd=ivns&tbm=isch&tbo=u&source=univ&sa=X&ei=hISuTanyFIayhAfx7eTdAw&ved=0CFMQsAQ&biw=1816&bih=974 )  
09:02 <vmassol> look for origin/master  
09:02 <+mflorea> this is what I have http://lwn.net/Articles/140350/  
09:02 <vmassol> and origin/xwiki-3.0  
09:02 <vmassol> yes but scroll up or down to see the labels  
09:04 <+mflorea> my first label is "master - remotes/origin/master"  
09:05 <+mflorea> i.e. the top label  
09:05 <vmassol> let me take a screenshot of what I see  
09:06 <vmassol> http://tinycoke.com/\_6rTjMoKDPzI/screen\_shot\_2011-04-20\_at\_9.05.22\_am.png  
09:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: http://tinycoke.com/\_6rHRnswCzcsA/gitk.png  
09:15 <+mflorea> but I don't see any line between master and xwiki-3.0. I think xwiki-3.0 is shown before because it has more recent commits  
09:18 <vmassol> well the issue is not that it's shown first I think  
09:18 <vmassol> it's that it's on the left line (ie the main one)  
09:18 <vmassol> it wasn't like this yesterday btw  
09:20 <vmassol> it's possible that indeed there's something I don't understand. I just want to be sure it's ok because it looks strange right now to me  
09:20 <vmassol> I hope it's just a representation thing and no real issue  
09:21 <+mflorea> I don't know how to read those lines either, but I'm sure I didn't broke anything on master. Everything looks fine on the command line  
09:23 <vmassol> I'm asking some git pros  
09:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <lucaa> has quit  
09:55 <vmassol> mflorea: apparently the git pro says it should be ok and it's probably how gitx was coded only  
09:55 <+mflorea> great  
09:57 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <sburjan> has quit  
10:21 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <+sburjan> vmassol: Hi ! is it okay to report issues in JIRA on XWiki Platform / {{unused}} Macros and Filters ?  
10:33 <vmassol> sburjan: nope  
10:33 <vmassol> you should use the new components  
10:35 <+sburjan> and where would a bug for a macro (Attachment Selector Macro) go ?  
10:35 <vmassol> sburjan: if your issue is about macros either it's a  macro in the rendering project (in that case it should be reported in that project's jira) or it's a macro in platform and in this case it shoudl be reported in platfrom under "rendering"  
10:35 <+sburjan> ok. thanks  
10:35 <vmassol> wait  
10:35 <vmassol> where is this macro?  
10:35 <+sburjan> well on extensions it says it's bundled with XE/XEM, but I don't know if it's on platform or not  
10:36 <vmassol> it might be on xe  
10:36 <vmassol> checking  
10:37 <vmassol> ok first it's a wiki macro  
10:38 <vmassol> checking where it's located now  
10:38 <vmassol> sburjan: it's XE now  
10:38 <+sburjan> how did you check that vmassol  ? (si I know  in the future)  
10:38 <+sburjan> \*so  
10:38 <vmassol> I started XE  
10:38 <vmassol> when to XWiki.WikiMacros  
10:39 <vmassol> saw it was listed  
10:39 <vmassol> got the name of the page where the macro is located  
10:39 <vmassol> then searched the sources for AttahmentSelector.xml  
10:39 <vmassol> but  
10:39 <vmassol> don't worry if you report it in the wrong place  
10:39 <vmassol> the person who handles it will move it if need be  
10:39 <vmassol> it's hard to know  
10:39 <vmassol> (in this case)  
10:40 <vmassol> and IMO it's not in the right place ;)  
10:40 <vmassol> (that macro has nothing to do with XE IMO)  
10:43 <+sburjan> thanks.  
10:44 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: We should replace all @Requirement with @Inject @Named, right?  
10:56 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes + ad @Singleton  
11:03 <vmassol> s/ad/add/

12:18 <+lucaa> is there a way to configure github to send the name of the committer when sending a notification mail?  
12:18 <+lucaa> in the sender field, for example

12:19 <@sdumitriu> lucaa: we just talked about that on the dev skype chat

14:36 <vmassol> (those are the planned dates)  
14:37 <+sburjan> ok. Tomorrow I'll test then, because on Friday and Tuesday I will be off.  
14:38 <vmassol> ok, not sure there's that many new things though. I'll have a quick look  
14:39 <+sburjan> well, testing doesn't mean only testing new features. I test everything on all browsers  
14:39 <vmassol> I know  
14:49 <ihalip\_> is now known as <ihalip>  
14:57 <+sburjan> do we have some new feature in M1 ?  
15:00 <@sdumitriu> Not really  
15:01 <+sburjan> okay  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: http://mojo.codehaus.org/buildnumber-maven-plugin/ "Note that currently, supported SCMs are : subversion, git and mercurial."  
15:02 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: I just followed master. I can spend some time to investigate why it doesn't work for us  
15:09 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <drake01> has quit  
15:31 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <abusenius> has quit  
15:33 <@sdumitriu> I just tried the buildnumber 1.0 plugin, and it works with git  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> It generates the full SHA of the HEAD as the number: a289027652462c0d7a706ee5fca2a56571c8a1f4  
15:34 <vmassol> ah cool I thought the git support was still snapshot  
15:34 <vmassol> now I'm not sure we need to use it at all  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> 1.0 released a few ago  
15:34 <@sdumitriu> a few days  
15:34 <vmassol> although it's nice, in practice we've never used the svn rev in the version  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> Yes we did  
15:35 <@sdumitriu> Actually, depends on what you mean by "use"  
15:35 <vmassol> found it useful  
15:35 <vmassol> for real  
15:36 <@sdumitriu> It's a bit useless since we always release different versions  
15:36 <@sdumitriu> So there aren't two 3.0 versions  
15:36 <vmassol> the idea was more for snapshot initially I think  
15:36 <vmassol> so that we could know exactly  
15:36 <vmassol> when a user using a snapshot was reporting an issue  
15:36 <vmassol> which exact version he was using  
15:37 <vmassol> but again I don't recall we really used that  
15:37 <vmassol> (in practice)  
15:37 <vmassol> so personally I'd be +1 to remove the usage of it till we have a real need again  
15:37 <@sdumitriu> We could activate it only on snapshot jenkins builds  
15:38 <vmassol> yes but again we haven't used it so it's extra complexity for not much  
15:41 <@sdumitriu> Then the right thing to do is to remove ${buildNumber} from version.properties, agreed?  
15:41 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
15:41 <vmassol> yes, fine with me  
15:41 <vmassol> I can send the mail  
15:41 <@sdumitriu> Committing  
15:42 <vmassol> sending mail  
15:44 <vmassol> sent

16:19 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: @Component("current")  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> becomes  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> @Component("current")  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> @Singleton  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> Right?  
16:26 <venkatesh> has quit  
16:26 <@sdumitriu> I mean the @Component annotation remains in place  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> Or does it also get an @Named("current")?  
16:27 <vmassol> yes  
16:27 <vmassol> 3 lines  
16:27 <vmassol> @Component  
16:27 <vmassol> @Named("current")  
16:27 <vmassol> @Singleton  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> K  
16:27 <vmassol> (@singleton only if it's not a per lookup ofc)  
16:27 <@sdumitriu> Indeed, it was in the javadoc of the Component  
16:28 <vmassol> (in which case we keep the current annotation for per lookup ftm)  
16:29 <+Denis> vmassol: got news from JetBrain, I should update our records with them, I am doing so right now  
16:30 <vmassol> Denis: great  
16:30 <kasun> has quit  
16:30 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: We don't add @Singleton for injected fields, right? Only for classes  
16:30 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes  
16:32 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
16:32 <vmassol> has quit  
16:32 <+Denis> vmassol: is http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/License really up to date ?  
16:32 <+Denis> Copyright 2004-2008, XpertNet SARL, and individual contributors. ?  
16:33 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:33 <+Denis> vmassol: is http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/License really up to date ?  
16:34 <+Denis> Copyright 2004-2008, XpertNet SARL, and individual contributors. ?  
16:34 <+Denis> JetBrain also insist that we qualify to these conditions: http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/buy/buy.jsp#openSource  
16:34 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Does it mean that all our components that haven't been updated are not singletons at the moment?  
16:34 <vmassol> sdumitriu: singleton is the default right now  
16:35 <vmassol> but we need to change that  
16:35 <vmassol> so the strategy is to specify explicitely all that are singletons  
16:35 <vmassol> in order to prepare for a future move  
16:35 <vmassol> then at some point we'll flip them  
16:36 <vmassol> and we'll just need to remove per looukp annotations  
16:36 <vmassol> (there aren't that many)  
16:36 <+Denis> vmassol: I am not sure we fully qualify on "you do not perform any paid support, consulting or training services for your open source software;"  
16:36 <vmassol> we do  
16:36 <vmassol> softec doesn't  
16:36 <vmassol> nor xwiki sas  
16:36 <vmassol> but the xwiki committers do  
16:37 <vmassol> otherwise I don't see any open source project qualifying  
16:37 <+Denis> I agree  
16:38 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
16:38 <+Denis> let see how they see it after ready the advertising on the download page  
16:38 <vmassol> it doesn't change anything IMO  
16:38 <vmassol> checking the copyright now  
16:39 <vmassol> updating it  
16:40 <jabba\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:42 <+Denis> vmassol: they ask the number of developers, last year was 16, this year 17 (the core committers)  
16:43 <vmassol> yes they're listed on the hall of fame page  
16:43 <sburjan> has quit  
16:47 <jabba\_> has quit  
16:51 <vmassol> Denis: just received a mail from jetbrains. You put my email address? :)  
16:51 <vmassol> "Thank you for taking the time to submit your membership form. The IntelliJ IDEA review board will evaluate your request over the next few days. We will make every effort to take care of this promptly and will notify you as soon as the review board has come to a decision."  
16:51 <+Denis> it was in the form, you were the resposible person, I have not change it  
16:51 <vmassol> ok

17:00 <@sdumitriu> Can someone update the jira configuration for git repositories?  
17:00 <@sdumitriu> It references the old xwiki-platform-core

17:01 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I'll check  
17:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hmm do you know what repository root is: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/ViewGitRepositories.jspa ?  
17:04 <vmassol> it's where it's supposed to be cloned locally?  
17:04 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
17:04 <vmassol> (it doesn't work when I change it - ok will delete and recreate)  
17:04 <@sdumitriu> But I think it must be created on the filesystem  
17:04 <vmassol> ah  
17:04 <vmassol> ok that would explain why it was failing  
17:04 <@sdumitriu> git clone from the console  
17:05 <jabbadabba> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <jabbadabba> Hi guys, I am having trouble with the display of available languages at the Main.WebHome, everywhere else it's fine. There should be only de and en, but there are several other languages displayed. I already tried to delete and recreate the Main.WebHome > No effect. Config: Languages: de, en | Default: en. What am I doing wrong?  
17:14 <@sdumitriu> Nothing  
17:15 <@sdumitriu> Those translations do exist, they come by default with XE  
17:15 <@sdumitriu> Just click on each language and delete the translations  
17:15 <@sdumitriu> (delete page)  
17:16 <supreet> has joined #xwiki  
17:20 <qwebirc29054> has joined #xwiki  
17:21 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Could you check https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a5b261e1c090a0439ae495133284f8b25b8dd1fa ?  
17:23 <vmassol> sdumitriu: reviewed. It's good  
17:29 <jabbadabba> @sdumitriu: oh, that's easy. thx  
17:30 <chanikag> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <Chami> has joined #xwiki  
17:36 <jabbadabba> hm, i am logged in as superadmin, but i can't see "delete page" - i just can delete pages in the document index - and there are no translations available to delete. where can i delete those translations? so sorry for the stupid questions.  
17:37 <@sdumitriu> jabbadabba: That's a bug (reported today, conincidence), you can either login as a normal admin, or you can just manually alter the URL to replace /view/ with /delete/  
17:39 <jabbadabba> oh, very bad timing;)  
17:39 <jabbadabba> thank you  
17:50 <JunHAN> has joined #xwiki

20:41 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Can you help me with some knowledge of the rendering?  
20:41 <vmassol> sure  
20:41 <vmassol> shoot

23:01 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Reading http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Skins and there's something I don't like  
23:01 <@sdumitriu> "Copy all files from webapps/xwiki/skins/colibri folder into your new skin directory."  
23:01 <@sdumitriu> This is a very bad practice  
23:02 <@sdumitriu> Only the files that are overwritten should be copied,  
23:02 <@sdumitriu> since otherwise the skin will make it very hard to upgrade future versions  
23:21 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: as far as I remember, that page contains tutorials on different methods overriding a skin, one with and one without access to fs  
23:22 <+sburjan`> It's a start on how to create a new skin, not how to override it  
23:23 <+sburjan`> if you want and don't consider it fit, you can remove that. But I've only redone the page, so that was there long before I touched that page
